hackathon-description-text: AtomHacks is a unique opportunity for Bronx Science students to work in teams, apply their computer science skills, innovate and problem solve to create something new.
hackathon-rules:
A valid submission is a software/hardware hack produced at AtomHacks. Teams are free to use any programming language.
Hacks must be submitted to the AtomHacks site on Devpost by 8pm on Saturday, May 14th.
Teams will have three minutes to explain and demonstrate their hack to judges.
All hackers must follow the code of conduct, detailed at

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: iPad Mini to all team members
$100 Amazon gift card to all team members

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=75 Bronx Science Blvd, Bronx, NY 10468, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How unique is the idea or concept? Does it take a new perspective on an old problem or present a new idea?
Does the hack work? Is it well designed? How is the user experience? Does it demonstrate a knowledge or understanding of the computer programming language used?
Who is the target audience for this hack? Does it help solve a problem or challenge that the target audience experiences?

hackathon-location-address: 75 Bronx Science Blvd, Bronx, NY 10468, USA
hackathon-location-description: The Bronx High School of Science
